newsitem.title: ZAIRE: New Zaire army chief says rebels will be defeated.
newsitem.headline: New Zaire army chief says rebels will be defeated.

text.p: Zaire's new army chief vowed on Monday to defeat Rwandan-backed rebels who have captured territory in the east of the country, national television said.
"Our cause is just and legitimate. Those who have imposed the war on us...will pay a heavy price. We will fight it out. We will win," General Mahele Lieko Bokungu said in an address to soldiers.
Zaire's ill-disciplined, under-equipped and poorly paid troops have been so far routed by the rebels who are reported to have advanced to the town of Mangbalu in eastern Zaire.
General Mahele said the army would fight the war according to internationally accepted rules.
"We have been humiliated, but we will not harm innocent people. Children and women will not be harmed. We will not harm civilians, our target is known," he said.
He added that Zaire had no choice but to launch a major counter-offensive to recapture the territory lost.
"Our men have been retreating for a while. But Kinshasa cannot receive as many as 45 million people (Zaire's total population). So we have to hit back," he said.
He added that the army was waiting for a green light from President Mobutu Sese Seko.

The government has ruled out negotiation with rebel leader Laurent Kabila, but analysts say Zaire is not in a position to inflict heavy losses on the better equipped rebels. Many politicians are increasingly in favour of a peaceful settlement.

"I know that a group of soldiers have misbehaved, but I want to ask for forgiveness. Let's forget what has happened. Let's rely on our army. We need the backing of the population to carry out our duty," Mahele said.
